items.title: Lexington and Concord: 22 Hours and a Shot Heard Around the World
items.excerpt: In celebration of the upcoming 250th anniversary of the United States, the National Archives is highlighting key events in our nation’s journey to independence. This edition explores the first battles of the American Revolutionary War: Lexington and Concord. Today’s post comes…

items.title: Presidential Transitions – Roosevelt to Truman
items.excerpt: Today’s post is from Tammy K. Williams, archivist & social media manager at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library and Museum.
